titleStmt.title: Laws and acts past in the third session of the first Parliament of our most high and dread soveraign, Charles the Second, by the grace of God, King of Scotland, England, France and Ireland, defender of the faith. Holden at Edinburgh, from the eighteenth of June, 1663. to the ninth of October thereafter, on which day the Parliament was dissolved; by a noble lord, John Earl of Rothes, Lord Lefly and Bambreith ... / with the special advice and consent of the Estates of Parliament.
Laws, etc.
titleStmt.author: Scotland.
Rothes, John Leslie, Earl of, 1630?-1681.
Scotland. Convention of Estates.

publicationStmt.publisher: Re-printed by Andrew Anderson, Printer to the King's most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Royal arms on t.p. verso; headpiece; initial letters.
Tables of printed and unprinted acts: [12] p. at end.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
